channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Homan plans to pull agents from Minnesota. And, Senate strikes short-term funding deal
item.description: Border czar Tom Homan has suggested possibly pulling some federal immigration agents out of Minnesota. And, Senate leaders struck a short-term funding deal to keep most of the government running.
item.content:encoded:
Border czar Tom Homan has suggested possibly pulling some federal immigration agents out of Minnesota. And, Senate leaders struck a short-term funding deal to keep most of the government running.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump taps Kevin Warsh to lead the Federal Reserve
item.description: Trump plans to nominate Kevin Warsh to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve, when Jerome Powell's term expires in May. The president has been pushing the central bank to slash interest rates.
item.content:encoded:
Trump plans to nominate Kevin Warsh to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve, when Jerome Powell's term expires in May. The president has been pushing the central bank to slash interest rates.

(Image credit: Tasos Katopodis)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Are you on a high-deductible health plan? What do you wish you knew?
item.description: People with ACA health insurance just saw prices surge and many switched to plans with high deductibles and health savings accounts. If that's you, what do you wish you knew about how your plan works?
item.content:encoded: People with ACA health insurance just saw prices surge and many switched to plans with high deductibles and health savings accounts. If that's you, what do you wish you knew about how your plan works?

item.title: U.S. life expectancy is going up. Think how many more news quizzes you can do!
item.description: When the news gets too heavy, the quiz is forced to turn to pop culture questions — so there are a lot this week. Let's see how you do!
item.content:encoded: When the news gets too heavy, the quiz is forced to turn to pop culture questions — so there are a lot this week. Let's see how you do!
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Kari Lake promotes Trump on Voice of America. Does that break the law?
item.description: Critics say U.S. Agency for Global Media's Kari Lake risks making Voice of America sound like a propaganda outlet in her remarks on the air praising President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Critics say U.S. Agency for Global Media's Kari Lake risks making Voice of America sound like a propaganda outlet in her remarks on the air praising President Trump.

(Image credit: Voice of America)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Trump thinks a weaker dollar is great for America. Is he right?
item.description: The president said this week that the value of the dollar is "great" despite a sharp tumble since last year. That may be true for certain parts of the economy — but not others.
item.content:encoded:
The president said this week that the value of the dollar is "great" despite a sharp tumble since last year. That may be true for certain parts of the economy — but not others.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: Want to be part of a village? You might need to get out of your comfort zone
item.description: If you've always dreamed of having a village but feel disconnected from your community, try these five tips. Plus: We want to hear from you. Tell us how you cultivate community where you live.
item.content:encoded: If you've always dreamed of having a village but feel disconnected from your community, try these five tips. Plus: We want to hear from you. Tell us how you cultivate community where you live.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Kalshi in court over 19 federal lawsuits. What's the future of prediction markets?
item.description: Apps that let people wager on current events have experienced explosive growth in Trump's second term. But one of the leading markets is tied up in lawsuits that cloud the industry's future.
item.content:encoded:
Apps that let people wager on current events have experienced explosive growth in Trump's second term. But one of the leading markets is tied up in lawsuits that cloud the industry's future.

(Image credit: Olga Fedorova)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: FAQ: What is wind chill, and why is it dangerous?
item.description: Strong winds can make it feel a lot colder than the thermometer suggests. Protect yourself by covering exposed skin and sheltering inside.
item.content:encoded:
Strong winds can make it feel a lot colder than the thermometer suggests. Protect yourself by covering exposed skin and sheltering inside.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hersher

item.title: A year after deadly midair collision near Washington, families push for safety changes
item.description: On the anniversary of the midair collision near Washington, D.C., families of the victims are still working for laws to prevent future disasters. And they say they're ready for a long fight.
item.content:encoded:
On the anniversary of the midair collision near Washington, D.C., families of the victims are still working for laws to prevent future disasters. And they say they're ready for a long fight.

(Image credit: Luke Johnson)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose
